intro: [WRONG START] Pleiosprios framesii, commonly known as the red-tipped pincushion, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiky foliage that resembles a pincushion, with a reddish tinge on the tips of its leaves. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
